author: gizamo
body: Dev here. I'll pass. AWS, Azure, and GCP all offer their own CDNs for free, and if I'm going to pay for another CDN, it'd be Netlify, or if on AWS, maybe Datapath....which might be free, I don't remember. Point is, CDNs are going to be dominated by the biggies or the freebies. There is no need for intermediates, imo.

author: CarlSagan79
body:
> It may be an annual reoccurrence like the common influenza.

But this is also what they said about SARS and Avian Flu and Swine Flu and Zika. It's this weird 5 year cadence that seems to match more appropriately with a new cycle than anything viruses are doing.

It's like sharks, but more RNA.

author: gizamo
body: Lol. [You blatantly lie](https://aws.amazon.com/cloudfront/) and then claim I don't have experience. Idiot. Then, you seeming intentionally misconstrue my meanings for Netlify and Datapath. [Netlify Edge](https://www.netlify.com/products/edge/) and Datapath's cloud-to-cloud are advancements upon CDNs. I was saying that if you're going to pay for something like Cloudflare, you should be doing something more specific or something better that ties in with AWS, GCP, and Azure CDNs. But, yes you're right there hundreds like datapath, just as there are hundreds like Cloudflare. If you're not willing to pay for AWS, GCP, or Azure, itmeans you're going the cheapest route possible, which might land you with Cloudflare, or much more likely, you'll piece together a bunch of the cheaper services and free services out there to do whatever specific thing you want. From what I can tell, Cloudflare is picking up scraps at best, and is getting squeezed in a race to the bottom.

author: ManiGandham
body:
Cloudflare is a CDN, security (DDOS/firewall/vpn/beyondcorp access) and edge computing company that handles roughly 10% of the internet's traffic. It's also free for the vast majority of users, and one of the only CDNs that doesn't charge for bandwidth.

None of the clouds offer a CDN for free, they all charge on bandwidth and all cloud vendors are notoriously expensive for that. Netlify isn't a CDN, it's a static site hosting service that uses Fastly and other actual CDNs. Datapath isn't a CDN, it's a 3rd tier networking company amongst hundreds in that niche.

You don't seem to have much experience with space.

author: KennyFulgencio
body: yeah his cadence was all fucked, like he knew how to pronounce the words but not what they meant or where to place any emphasis

author: WhaIeBones
body: >read to the cadence of captain Barbossa

author: ManiGandham
body:
AWS Cloudfront isn't free, it just has a free tier enough for serving a personal website. Netlify Edge is just marketing. They host static files and run on top of the other clouds. It's nothing special, anyone can spin up some Nginx servers and host content. 

CDNs are global, it doesn't matter where you run your infrastructure in order to use them and not using the cloud doesn't mean you're looking for the cheapest route. Cloudflare and runner up Fastly are the next generation CDNs taking on plenty of legacy companies and growing rapidly every quarter.

Your post makes it clear that you have zero experience with any of this beyond reading some marketing pages. And your focus on the Cloudfront free tier sounds like you don't have much scale or budget either.

author: The91stGreekToe
body:
I’m not sure what the nature of your work is but there are some basic rules. I’ve been on a remote project for 9 months. 

1.) Always log in early so your availability (Skype, Teams, etc) shows green 
2.) Reply to emails and messages quickly 
3.) If workload is low, make sure your deliverables are on fucking point 
4.) Never confide in coworkers (even friends) how little work you actually do
5.) Ask boss if he/she needs help
6.) Stay logged on later than your peers. Even if you’re just moving your trackpad every 5 minutes it’ll show that you’re available - e.g. “that dedicated motherfucker is STILL online?” Meanwhile you’re doing blow and drinking beer while appearing productive 
7.) If your calendar is empty, create false meetings for yourself with no invitees. 
8.) If you MUST do cocaine on the job, be sure the cadence of your voice is not atypical 

If you have any additional questions, check my calendar for availability (spoiler alert - it’s fucking full).

author: roundearththeory
body: Do you think the impact of the stay at home orders and the upcoming consoles are perfectly priced in? It's an interesting scenario, content providers and CDNs are bursting at the seams and require more cheap compute. Furthermore, there is less expendable cash but more people are staying in.

author: thekingoftherodeo
body:
Not necessarily, it would give you more time to assess the actual impact of COVID in the MD&A.

In the case of Companies with material trade receivables it'll also give time to properly estimate the difference between Day One CECL adoption (where you can't justify adjustment for COVID) and calculated actuals as of 3/31 which will hit the Income Statement and will most definitely generate noise.

Many will keep the same cadence for fear of spooking the market though accepted.
